New Records: CJ McCollum scored a career-high 50 points with 10 three-pointers, tying his franchise high of 11 made threes.
The New Orleans Pelicans tied a season high with 18 made three-pointers, going 18 of 41.
Key Match Events: CJ McCollum had his toe on the 3-point line when he hit a 21-foot jumper to give New Orleans a 128-111 lead, which was initially ruled a 3-pointer but reduced to a 2-pointer on video review.
Pre-Game Insights: The Pelicans were playing at home for the first time since a deadly New Yearâ€™s Day attack in the French Quarter, and a moment of silence was held before tipoff.
Post-Match Reflections: The Wizards scored a season-high 72 points in the paint, only to have it virtually negated by shaky outside shooting and porous defense that allowed New Orleans a season high in points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jose Alvarado, who had been out with a right hamstring strain, returned and contributed 5 points, 3 assists, and 3 steals in 20 minutes.
Others: The Pelicans and Wizards share the dubious distinction of having the fewest victories in the league with both teams at 6-29.
